DataElement.preferredName: Caregiver Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire Feelings About the Amount of Information Known About Cancer Prognosis 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation, considering all things, of how they feel about the amount of information their loved one knows about the likely outcome of the cancer over time, using a 3 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Caregiver Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire Feelings About the Amount of Information Known About Cancer Prognosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional._A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care._A question about a person's feelings about the amount of information they know about the likely outcome of the patient's cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Caregiver Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.:A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care.

Concepts.definition: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care.

Property.preferredName: Feelings About the Amount of Information Known About Cancer Prognosis
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about a person's feelings about the amount of information they know about the likely outcome of the patient's cancer.

Concepts.longName: Feelings About the Amount of Information Known About Cancer Prognosis
Concepts.definition: A question about a person's feelings about the amount of information they know about the likely outcome of the patient's cancer.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PTPQ:Prognosis and Treatment Perceptions Questionnaire as referenced in Associations Among Prognostic Understanding, Quality of Life, El-Jawahri A, et.al., 2014
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Alliance study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 5/28/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard with three text responses related to the amount of information an individual has or wants about their prognosis.

PermissibleValues.value: I wish I had less information about my prognosis

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person would have liked less information about the patient's prognosis.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person would have liked less information about the patient's prognosis.

PermissibleValues.value: I now have about the right amount of information
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Have Right Amount of Information About Prognosis

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Have Right Amount of Information About Prognosis
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person has the right amount of information about the patient's prognosis.

Concepts.longName: Have Right Amount of Information About Prognosis
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person has the right amount of information about the patient's prognosis.

PermissibleValues.value: I wish I had more information about my prognosis

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person would like more information about the patient's prognosis.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person would like more information about the patient's prognosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: PTPQ:Prognosis and Treatment Perceptions Questionnaire as referenced in Associations Among Prognostic Understanding, Quality of Life, El-Jawahri A, et.al., 2014
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for Alliance study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 5/28/14

ReferenceDocuments.name: All things considered, how do
ReferenceDocuments.description: All things considered, how do you feel about the amount of information your loved one knows about the likely outcome of their cancer over time (i.e. their prognosis)?

DataElement.origin: PTPQ:Prognosis and Treatment Perceptions Questionnaire as referenced in Associations Among Prognostic Understanding, Quality of Life, El-Jawahri A, et.al., 2014
DataElement.changeDescription: Created for Alliance study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 5/29/14
